message.text: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection').

properties.description: A software system that accepts and executes input in the form of operating system commands (e.g. system()) could allow an attacker with lesser privileges than the target software to execute commands with the elevated privileges of the executing process.

taxa.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

message.text: Use of Uninitialized Variable.

properties.description: Uninitialized pointer is used.

message.text: NULL Pointer Dereference.

properties.description: The pointer p is dereferenced even though the value is null.

message.text: Improper Control of Resource Identifiers ('Resource Injection').

properties.description: Allowing user input to control resource identifiers may enable an attacker to access or modify otherwise protected system resources.

taxa.name: Improper Control of Resource Identifiers ('Resource Injection')

message.text: Heap-based Buffer Overflow.

properties.author: Jonathan Diamond
properties.description: The test case shows a Heap Overflow by trying to insert out of the bounds of the buffer a character. The code has a Array Address complexity.

message.text: Use of Hard-coded Password.

properties.description: The test cases shows hard-coded password is used in a function.

properties.description: A stack-based buffer overflow condition is a condition where the buffer being overwritten is allocated on the stack. In the case of C++, misusing container vector could also cause stack overflow.
